creator: notzippy@hotmail.com
text:
Typing in a statement like
<jsp:include page="<%=request.getParameter("pagina") %>" />
in a jsp page gives an exception org.apache.jasper.compiler.ParseException
it looks as though jasper does not correctly parse the page attribute and 
reports attribute "pagina" has no value.
In the user archives Ive seen this error and I have also gotten the same 
message. But I did not find a bug report on it (Sorry if it is a repeat).
There are a number of workarounds like assigning a string the value then 
assigning the value to the page attribute
<%String t=request.getParameter("pagina"); %>
<jsp:include page="<%=t%>" />
Will work just fine.

creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
Section 2.4 of the JSP 1.1 spec states that the inner quotes must be escaped.
The following works for me:

<jsp:include page="<%=request.getParameter(\"pagina\") %>" flush="true" />
